doc:doc.doc:summary: Service interface.
The service name
The localized service display name
The service type - *NOT* to be confused with the sharing type! This is used for grouping in context menus/lists.
The share type in question
Whether the service supports the share type specified
Whether the service is currently available
If applicable, the state of credentials. Valid values are 0 (Valid), 1 (Invalid), and 2 (Unknown). If this is not applicable for your plugin, it is expected to return Valid.
A localized, descriptive text of the current service state.
The widget set being used. Right now, only QML custom UI widgets are supported.
The platform this is running on - this is used for UI differentiation between platforms. If you only have 1 UI, ignore this value.
The product this is running on - this is used for UI differentiation between products. If you only have 1 UI, ignore this value
The type of sharing being done. Same valid values as the CanShareType::sharetype argument. This allows for custom UI widgets on a per-service, per-datatype basis

The number of items that the user is trying to share. This allows for custom UI widgets/flows based on item quantity - typical usage is just varying between single/multiple item UIs, but with actualy quantity being passed, things can get fancier
The identifier for the requested UI widget/element name
A platform identifier that the plugin can use to decide how its settings should be invoked. If you only have 1 settings UI, you can ignore this value
A product identifier that the plugin can use to decide how its settings should be invoked. If you only have 1 settings UI, you can ignore this value
The URI needed for invoking the settings URI for this service on this platform - this URI will be launched via exec, so it can be an executable w/ arguments, or a dbus-send command, etc.
Sent if *something* about the service changes (Availability, Creds State, Type of sharing supported, etc.). It's up to the client to figure out what changed and handle accordingly
The name of the service that is sending the signal
